node.title: China records first case of Omicron COVID variant
node.alt: People wearing face masks walk in a shopping district of Beijing
node.description: Health authorities in northern China's port city of Tianjin have detected the first case of the Omicron coronavirus variant, potentially challenging the country's strict zero-COVID approach.
node.content:
["Health authorities in northern China's port city of Tianjin have detected the first case of the Omicron coronavirus variant in the country's mainland, state media reports.", "The infection was discovered in a traveller who arrived in the city from overseas on December\u00a09, the Tianjin Daily\u00a0reported, adding that the patient is currently being treated in isolation in hospital.", "The state-run Global Times newspaper reported that the patient is a Polish national who arrived in Tianjin from Warsaw\u00a0and was asymptomatic.", "\"We do not need to be afraid of Omicron with the implementation of the dynamic zero-case policy and strictly observing the precise prevention and control measures,\"\u00a0China's top respiratory expert, Zhong Nanshan, was quoted as saying.", "Arrival of the Omicron variant \u2014 which scientists believe is more infectious than previous variants of COVID\u00a0\u2014 potentially poses a challenge to China's strict COVID-zero approach.", "Semi-autonomous Hong Kong, which is following the mainland's zero-COVID strategy, has already reported seven cases of the Omicron variant among incoming travellers.", "China's vaccination rate is among the world's highest and authorities have begun administering booster shots as winter descends.", "Despite isolated cases in various parts of the country, China has been able to suppress major outbreaks over the past year.", "It has reported just over 4,600 deaths\u00a0compared to almost 800,000 in the US, a country with less than a quarter of the population.", "China pioneered the approach of strict lockdowns, multiple rounds of mass testing and centralised quarantine, during the world's first major outbreak of the coronavirus in Wuhan.", "The strategy continues now, even as the government says it has vaccinated more than 82 per cent of the country's 1.41 billion people.", "A total of 1.162 billion people have received the required number of doses to complete vaccinations, Wu Liangyou, an official of the National Health Commission said last week, adding that 120.6 million had received a booster shot.", "Despite the high national rate, vaccination coverage remained patchy among the elderly, a vulnerable group facing a high risk of severe cases and death after infection.", "Vaccination rates for those older than 80 were slightly above 40 per cent, falling below 30 per cent\u00a0in some areas, said Zheng Zhongwei, another official, in an interview with state broadcaster CCTV.", "", "
Does the arrival of Omicron make boosters more urgent?
", "ABC/wires"]
